skill.name: when-analyzing-performance-use-performance-analysis
skill.description: Comprehensive performance analysis, bottleneck detection, and optimization recommendations for Claude Flow swarms
skill.summary: Comprehensive performance analysis, bottleneck detection, and optimization recommendations for Claud...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files, example bash scripts, and a graphviz diagram. No executable code, no file operations, no network calls. The bash examples document CLI invocations of claude-flow commands but do not execute anything.

content.value_statement: Claude Flow swarms often face performance bottlenecks that slow down task completion. This skill provides a systematic five-phase approach to establish baselines, profile systems, identify bottlenecks, apply optimizations, and validate improvements with measurable results.
actual_capabilities: Establish performance baselines with metrics collection
Profile system resources including CPU, memory, and network
Apply optimization recommendations to improve swarm performance
limitations: Requires Claude Flow to be installed and active
Does not modify code directly - provides recommendations only
Performance gains depend on system resources and configuration

use_cases.title: Optimize CI/CD pipelines
use_cases.description: Identify bottlenecks in swarm-based deployment workflows and apply optimizations to reduce build times and improve throughput

use_cases.title: Improve multi-agent productivity
use_cases.description: Analyze coordination overhead between agents and rebalance workloads to maximize parallel task completion rates

use_cases.title: Maintain performance baselines
use_cases.description: Monitor system performance over time, detect regressions, and validate that optimizations maintain expected performance levels

prompt_templates.title: Quick performance check
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the performance-analysis skill to establish a baseline for my current swarm and identify any major bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: Deep profiling session
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a comprehensive performance analysis including CPU hotspots, memory usage, and network latency profiling across all active agents.

prompt_templates.title: Optimization sprint
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my swarm performance data and recommend specific optimizations. Apply safe optimizations automatically and show me what was changed.

prompt_templates.title: Regression validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my previous baseline metrics with current performance. Calculate improvement percentages and validate whether targets of 15% throughput gain and 20% latency reduction were met.

output_examples.input: Analyze my swarm performance and optimize bottlenecks
output: Critical bottlenecks found: Agent coordination overhead (127ms avg), Memory spikes in 3 agents
Optimizations applied: Increased max parallel tasks to 8, enabled LRU caching, rebalanced agent workloads
Results validated: Throughput improved by 23% (178.6 tasks/min), Latency reduced by 31% (26.5ms)

best_practices: Always establish a baseline before applying optimizations to accurately measure improvement
Run profiling for at least 300 seconds with 5-second intervals to capture representative performance data
Apply optimizations incrementally and validate after each change to identify what works
anti_patterns: Skipping baseline establishment and making changes without measurement
Applying all optimizations at once without tracking which changes help
Focusing on low-impact optimizations while ignoring critical bottlenecks

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. It requires Claude Flow installed to execute the performance commands.

faq.question: How long does a full analysis take?
faq.answer: A complete five-phase analysis takes 30-60 minutes. The baseline and profiling phases require 5-10 minutes of data collection.

faq.question: Can I use this without Claude Flow?
faq.answer: No. This skill is designed specifically for Claude Flow swarms and uses its performance monitoring and optimization commands.

faq.question: Is my performance data stored?
faq.answer: The skill can store baseline metrics and analysis results in Claude Flow memory for historical tracking if you configure the memory store commands.

faq.question: What if performance gets worse after optimization?
faq.answer: The skill includes validation phases to catch regressions. If targets are not met, the workflow loops back to re-analyze before applying different optimizations.

faq.question: How is this different from general profiling tools?
faq.answer: This skill is purpose-built for Claude Flow swarm patterns including agent coordination, task distribution, and multi-agent workflows specific to the platform.
